summary: Barbara J. Robinson was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). Her name appears on multiple payroll and certification reports spanning from April 1978 to January 1979. These documents list her as an employee, and include details such as her salary and employment dates. The documents suggest she was a staff member during the later stages of the SCAS investigation.
significance: Barbara J. Robinson's significance lies in her employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations. As a staff member, she was part of the team involved in the investigation of President Kennedy's assassination, although the specific nature of her role is not detailed in these documents.
